title: References with lifetime parameters in constant call to size_of crashses rustc

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-const-fn
labels.description: Area: const fn foo(..) {..}. Pure functions which can be applied at compile time.

body:
The following simpl file causes rustc to panic when compiling:
```
struct Foo<'a>
{
    a: [u8; std::mem::size_of::<&'a mut u8>()]
}
```

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.24.0-nightly (1956d5535 2017-12-03) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)`
  left: `Some(NodeId(4))`,
 right: `None`: free_scope: DefId(0/0:3 ~ test[8787]::Foo[0]) not recognized by the region scope tree for None / Some(DefId(0/0:3 ~ test[8787]::Foo[0]))', /checkout/src/librustc/middle/region.rs:729:12
```
